c74object.name: cage.volume
c74object.description: Modifies all the velocities in a bach.roll or bach.score multiplicatively or additively, or applies windowing on velocities.

objarg.name: number/symbol
objarg.digest: Initial velocity change or window name
objarg.description: An optional numeric argument sets the initial amount of velocity change (a factor if op is multiplicative, an addend if additive). A symbolic argument sets the name of a window function to be applied on the incoming score (see symbol). The default is a (multiplicative) factor of 1.

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs result of the last transposition.

method.name: float
method.digest: Set velocity change amount (fixed or lambda)
method.description: Any number in the right inlet sets the amount of change for the Velocities. Such change can be multiplicative or additive depending on the op attribute. Defaults to 1. (multiplicatively). If a lambda loop is in place, the velocity change is expected to be given for every incoming onset. The lambda loop will receive an onset (in milliseconds) and output the corresponding velocity change.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in the inlet is considered as the roll or score gathered syntax. Dynamics are globally changed and the resulting roll or score in gathered syntax is output through the outlet. The output header content is the same as the input header content. Change in dynamics is either multiplicative or additive (see op attribute). The amount change in dynamics is set via the right inlet (defaults to 1., multiplicatively), and an llll in such inlet is converted into a float. A symbol can be used to refer to most common windows (see symbol)

method.name: symbol
method.description: A symbol in the right inlet is assumed to be the name of a velocity window to be applied (if no lambda loop is present). It can be one of the following symbols: "rect", "tri", "sinc", "cosine", "hamming", "hann", "blackman", "gaussian".

attribute.name: dl
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to also process duration lines (breakpoints and tails). By default this is on.

attribute.name: gate
attribute.description: The output gate level: all the output notes with a velocity falling below this level will be deleted. The default is 0.

attribute.name: normalize
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to normalize the time coordinate between 0 (beginninng of score) and 1 (end of score).

attribute.name: op
attribute.description: The change operation: either * (for multiplicative changes, default) or + (for additive changes).
